abstract: Federal prosecutors have accused Richard T. Bistrong of paying business bribes to get contracts to supply protective gear to United Nations peacekeeping forces.
snippet: Federal prosecutors have accused Richard T. Bistrong of paying business bribes to get contracts to supply protective gear to United Nations peacekeeping forces.
lead_paragraph: Last year, according to people briefed on the case, a Florida businessman went undercover to play the part of a corrupt sales executive in a foreign bribery sting that led to nearly two dozen arrests and 16 indictments announced earlier this week.

headline.main: Supplier Accused of Bribes for U.N. Contracts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sting In Arms Deal Nets Stinger
